definition: (of a notable person etc) to honor with one's presence and offer guidance (idiom)
river in Hebei
to attend (an official function)/to be present/to administer/to approach (esp. as administrator)
variant of 蒞|莅[li4], to attend
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
to transmit/to lead/to guide/to conduct/to direct

sentences.english: The welcome general customers visit the instruction wholeheartedly.
sentences.chinese: 竭诚欢迎广大客户莅临指导。

sentences.english: We sincerely wish to provide excellent service to customers. The suggestion and guidance of people of all circles are cordially welcome.
sentences.chinese: 本公司竭诚为广大用户服务，欢迎各界人士莅临指导。

sentences.english: Welcome fellow masters to visit the instruction.
sentences.chinese: 欢迎各位高手莅临指导。

sentences.english: Warmly welcome the present guide of friends at home and abroad, and make progress together.
sentences.chinese: 热诚欢迎海内外各界朋友莅临指导，携手合作。

sentences.english: We warmly welcome new and old clients to visit.
sentences.chinese: 我们热忱欢迎海内外新老客户莅临指导。

sentences.english: All staff of JINHUADI invite the new-old friends to visit the company.
sentences.chinese: 金华帝全体员工诚邀新老朋友莅临指导。

definition: to arrive (esp. of notable person)/to visit (more formal than 光臨|光临[guang1 lin2])
to find time to do sth in the midst of pressing affairs
to be present at a meeting
we are honored by your presence
to have an informal discussion/CL:次[ci4],個|个[ge4]
Your presence brings light to my humble dwelling/see also 蓬蓽生光|蓬荜生光[peng2 bi4 sheng1 guang1]
all walks of life
inspection team
on-site inspection
conference/symposium/rap session
to cooperate on a great undertaking or joint project
to do sb the honor (of attending etc)/to put in an appearance/to show up
to participate in a meeting
to express in words or writing/to make a speech (esp. short introduction, vote of thanks, afterword, funeral homily etc)/to address (an audience)/same as 致詞|致词
at sb's invitation/on invitation
(polite) excuse me for not going out to meet you
